intro: Polygala welwitschii subsp. welwitschii, commonly known as the Welwitsch polygala, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, often branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showing adaptations to drought and poor soil conditions. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to greenish in color, and the species is known for its medicinal uses in traditional African medicine. The subspecies welwitschii is distinguished by its specific morphological traits that set it apart from other related species.
